name: McAllen HEC
description:
Pioneer Scholars are students dedicated to the successful completion of coursework towards TAMU degree offerings at the new McAllen Higher Education Center in the Lower Rio Grande Valley. 

“From its inception, our vision has been to provide students with opportunities to receive their degrees and the famous Aggie Ring by starting and completing their studies in McAllen,” said John Sharp, Chancellor. “As Pioneer Scholars, these students will embody the Texas A&M commitment to serve the people of the lower Rio Grande Valley.”


Currently, Texas A&M is only authorized to offer the bachelor of science in interdisciplinary engineering degree at the HEC. Engineering at Texas A&M University is among the nation’s very best with a variety of unique program offerings around the state with a target of meeting the world’s engineering needs of tomorrow. Our McAllen degree options are uniquely designed and specially tailored to meet the expected engineering needs of engineering in the Rio Grande Valley. The programs of study allow students an opportunity to have a unique impact on the growth and development of their home communities without leaving the region to pursue an engineering degree from Texas A&M University.


“We are proud to make this commitment for students in the Rio Grande Valley to earn one of the nation’s best engineering degrees,” said Michael K. Young, President.

Interested students may contact the Texas A&M – Rio Grande Valley Prospective Student center at 956-683-8647 or http://admissions.tamu.edu/MHEC for more information.
summary: Pioneer Scholars are students dedicated to the successful completion of coursework towards TAMU degree offerings at the new McAllen Higher Education Center in the Lower Rio Grande Valley.
